displayName.text: Kreuther Handcrafted Chocolate (at Gabriel Kreuther restaurant)

formattedAddress: 41 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Kreuther Handcrafted Chocolate (at Gabriel Kreuther restaurant)

adrFormatAddress: 41 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: French-influenced luxury chocolates, sculptures & pastries masterminded by a top pastry chef.

originalText.text:
I am excited to share that this is my inaugural dining experience at a two-star Michelin restaurant. After an extensive search for a remarkable and distinctive culinary adventure to celebrate my friend's birthday, I stumbled upon this particular restaurant. Remarkably, I was able to secure reservations on the same day.

The restaurant's location is fantastic, situated just across the street from Bryant Park in NYC. I must emphasize the impeccable service and exceptional attention to detail, which created an incredibly warm and inviting atmosphereâ€”an aspect that I truly appreciate!

For the price of $189 per person, I opted for the fixed four-course menu. Additionally, I indulged in an upgrade, adding Wagyu beef to my meal for an extra $45.

I want to highlight that when we received the first dish as a welcoming gesture, I was taken aback by the surprisingly small portion size of each dish. However, don't let the size deceive you. Despite their small appearance, every dish was packed with an extraordinary explosion of flavors. To be honest, after the fourth dish, we didn't feel hungry anymore, especially considering the satisfying desserts.

Additionally, we were pleasantly surprised to receive a complimentary birthday cake, which turned out to be delicious. Out of all the dishes, my personal favorites were the steak and the lamb

originalText.text: So delicious chocolate at the heart of 42nd Street. I didn't know there is a Two Michelin Star restaurant in that area and exquisite, delicious, mouthwatering chocolate next to it. I've tried the samples and this oh-so-good Chocolate Trifle Profiterole. Buy one. Have some. The flavor is balanced, not too sweet, not too bitter. It's just perfect. I love it! I told my friends about this spot. Well, you better check it out! Good quality chocolate that doesn't hurt your pocket.

text.text: So delicious chocolate at the heart of 42nd Street. I didn't know there is a Two Michelin Star restaurant in that area and exquisite, delicious, mouthwatering chocolate next to it. I told my friends about this spot. Well, you better check it out! Good quality chocolate that doesn't hurt your pocket.

originalText.text: Not exaggerating, but those are the worst chocolates I've had. Period. I tried every piece, and literally had to spit out most of them. A couple were edible but not great by any means. Not sure where all the 4 and 5 stars come from. Perhaps they have good macarons or other pastries? Anyway, what a waste. Literally ended up in the trash.

originalText.text: Chocolate elegance!  There are so many variations of chocolate to choose from.  I tried a sample of the pineapple coconut truffle and I  was immediately in heaven.  The texture was silky and the flavors were dancing in my mouth.  A must for chocolate lovers!!
